head.title: Investors Get a Break, but Some Lenders Absorb Blows

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Investors Get a Break, but Some Lenders Absorb Blows

block.p: The crisis in mortgage loans to people with weak, or subprime, credit intensified as a large lender, New Century Financial, stopped accepting loan applications because several of its financial backers cut off access to credit lines.

Fremont General, another big subprime lender, has said that it will leave that business as part of an agreement with banking regulators. Several dozen mortgage companies have gone out of business because of high default rates on mortgages written last year when lending standards were significantly more relaxed.
The next few weeks will be critical for New Century as it seeks to persuade its banks to let it stay in business.
